data.title: Really good pizza.
data.text:
This place does have very good pizza.   I think it is slightly expensive, but it is good, and this type of downtown, slightly upscale restaurant is REALLY what Abilene needs.  I won't give it 5 stars because I think those should be reserved for really superlative food.  I think the food was solidly very good.  A pizza with braised beef came recommended by the waitress.  It was good, but I wouldn't order it again.   Much better was the Margharita pizza and a pizza with prosciutto and ricotta.  They were delicious.  I loved the spreadable ricotta appetizer, served with pizza triangles.  The salads were good and were large enough to split with another person if that person is also eating pizza and isn't having the salad as their main course.  

Overall, this is fantastic for downtown Abilene.   Hooray, hooray!

data.title: Everything we hoped for!
data.text: My family was passing through town and per tradition we looked for the off-the-path place. We couldn't have been happier to have found Vagabond! The finish out of this old jewelry store was industrial but attractive. The staff was extremely friendly - and the owner showed that extra-special care for our family that makes you want to keep ordering food until they kick you out! Our three little ones wouldn't have allowed that but they did earn us a 5% off "Well Behaved Kids" discount (seriously a real thing!) and they loved seeing the brick oven and watching the dough toss. We will be back - and next time as just the two of us to enjoy the wine list of 101 different bottles, all with unique taste and next-level labels. Check this place out - and definitely get the Sofia or Chloe (both fantastic). Thanks Jessica for being such a great hostess!

data.title: Great in any big city, FABULOUS in Abilene
data.text:
Abilene is a sleepy town with a bunch of colleges thrown in for excitement.  The food choices reflect that.  There are loads of fast food and chain restaurants and a few privately owned nice places here and there to add a bit of spice.  Vagabond excels.  They local source their ingredients, make their own bread and butter daily, and the menu changes upon availability of the ingredients.  The decor is 'refurbished' warehouse and is tastefully done.  The noise level can be a bit high despite the VERY tall ceilings but that only adds to the fun.  We had 4 pizzas - plus one free one which was given to us since one of the pizzas developed a hole during the brick oven cooking process (we ate that one as well).  
As someone who lives in Pizza heaven (Boston) I can only say that Vagabond would thrive there - I hope it does the same in Abilene as it is one of the best of it's type I've been to - anywhere.

data.title: So nice and yummy!
data.text: Love this place. The atmosphere as well as the staff are great. There vegabond red wine is my favorite.  If there is a pizza with pickled peppers get it! Delicious!

data.title: Great Place!
data.text: We loved our first visit to Vagabond Pizza.  The staff was really friendly and helpful.  The atmosphere is outstanding.  We had the bread and butter appetizer to go with the craft beers on tap.  Then we enjoyed a Zoe and a Clara pizza.  They were very good!  We ended with the chocolate brownie dessert which was rich and sweet.  We will definitely be back soon!

data.title: Nice.
data.text:
We really enjoyed our experience, we had recently been to Boston and this restaurant was very similar to places like that. Something very different than the usual here in Abilene. Probably not much of a Kids place, kids were not too impressed ,but my husband and I will be back!
All the staff were very friendly, make sure that we were happy!

data.title: Great Pizza - Awful beer
data.text: Here is the positive and negative on this place. For starters, the appetizer and PIZZA were fantastic. A very good yeasty crust with just the right amount of sauce and toppings. We had a Rosalie and a Stillwater. Very tasty. The downside of this place is that they are trying to be a craft beer destination and the two beers that our party tried absolutely sucked. One tasted like balsamic vinegar, some sort of a "beer sour" attempt and one beer aged in Brandy casks that was equally horrible.   I think it's great that you want to offer craft brews, but please put a Shiner Bock or Bud Light or something on the menu that tastes good enough to drink. Overall, give this place a chance but stay with water or tea on the beverage side. Good luck.

data.title: Gross
data.text: Just gross. Rude staff! They got mad because I brought my pizza back that was raw in the middle. Never again.

owner_response.author: Jessica A, Owner at Vagabond Pizza, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm so sorry and quite horrified that you had this experience at Vagabond. Thank you for sharing, we will use this feedback to improve. Can you share more details about your visit, when you came in, what pizza you ordered and with whom you spoke, so that we can address with our staff? My email is jess@vagabondpizza.com. Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Mr & Mrs
data.text: Great Pizza and appetizers! They use the day old pizza dough and form into loaves of Bread. They serve it with basil infused butter they make! Service very good. Love the atmosphere! Fantastic wine list!

data.title: Tuesday evening dinner
data.text: Vagabond Pizza is a great addition to downtown Abilene. The pizzas are solid, with a great dough. The wine list has some great interesting selections and a good beer selection for most tastes. You will not find better pizza within 50 miles so try this if you are reading this.

data.title: Gem in the heart of Downtown Abilene!
data.text:
Don't miss out on delicious wood oven pizza featuring fresh ingredients right in the heart of bustling Downtown Abilene! You'll also appreciate the rustic decor and excellent wait staff as well. Their menus change frequently, so you always have new choices!

Save room for delicious dessert selections made by the pastry chef on site!

data.title: Great crust, great atmosphere
data.text: Fantastic gourmet  pizza and great ambience. I appreciated their selection of pizza combinations that were off menu, featuring the latest market finds. The Hatch chili and caramelized onions were especially fantastic. This food truck has made a great transition to brick and mortar in historic down town. It's ventures like this that are breathing new life in to downtown. Special kudos to hand spun crusts- thin, chewy, crusty and flavorful. I like that the owner was going table to table to connect with her growing customer base. Those who drank were happy with the craft beer selections.

owner_response.author: Jessica A, Owner at Vagabond Pizza, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind words! We look forward to seeing you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious Food - Upscale, Rustic Environment
data.text: Had been hearing about this place around town & with an afternoon meeting coming up downtown, decided to take a friend to find out what the buzz was all about. I had the Vagabon Salad - oh my goodness, it was probably the best I've enjoyed in quite a while - loved the vinegarette. We both enjoyed the tasty brick oven Bella Pizza! The building is a refurbished downtown building with exposed brick walls, decorative retro lighting and stained concrete floors.  If you've ever been to Rancho Pizzeria in Coleman, you'd think you had stepped back through their doors! Will definitely return, possibly in the evening to enjoy their wide selection of wines.

owner_response.author: Jessica A, Owner at Vagabond Pizza, responded to this review
owner_response.text: So glad you enjoyed the visit; we look forward to seeing you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice, family or friends and different pizza
data.text: Greeted immediately upon entering and escorted to our table.  Very friendly staff.  Pizza selection is different and very tasty, service was prompt.  Because the pizza is wood fired and hand tossed allow extra time.

owner_response.author: Jessie A, Owner at Vagabond Pizza, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
Had dinner here, Pizza was fantastic! Great appetizers, salads etc. They serve beer and wine , soft drinks only. 
Wonderful atmosphere. Great service from the staff. Ready for my next visit.

data.title: Gourmet pizza!
data.text:
These guys started out with a food truck and now they have a brick and mortar restaurant.  I couldn't be more thrilled!

They are located in the heart of downtown.

Food is superb and takes plain pizza to another level.  Gourmet ingredients, unusual combinations, and incredible attention to detail along with a great wine and beer selection makes this restaurant a must for anyone going through the downtown area.

data.title: Outstanding Service, Outstanding Food, Outstanding Atmosphere
data.text:
Do you like good service, great gourmet food and a great dining atmosphere?  Well if you do, please go see my friends at Vagabond Pizza.  You are met at the door by Jessica (Owner) who kicks off your experience with a smile.  She is so personable and just gets along with everyone.  She will take the time to visit with you and helps get you set up right away.  You will just want to smile right back at here.  The atmosphere is very cool.  Original wood floors, plaster walls peeled back to expose sections of brick walls and concrete columns, exposed wood roof trusses and sections of wood ceiling remain.  Simple modern light fixtures and exposed spiral ductwork complete the look.  

The menu is nice and short.  It is not overloaded, trying to deliver everything under the sun, but is small, and gives you the best of the best from Vagabond Pizza.  One sided, less than 8.5 x 11 in size, with starters, pizzas, desserts and drinks.  There is also a wine list available, so don’t think this is just another pizza joint with a guy in a white apron slinging out pies.  That just won’t do for Jason (Owner and Jessica’s Husband)

You can get a delicious salad to start, or some bread, or maybe both.  We had both and the homemade butter was awesome!  Then get a wood fired Margherita pizza or a Sofia, or Brisa.  Yes, you don’t order a Canadian bacon and pepperoni here, you get a real gourmet pizza with ingredients delivered from around the world, as well as locally.  The desserts are to die for.  Homemade and wonderful.

I can’t say enough about the wait staff either.  They are great, take very good care of you and are also very personable, taking the time to talk with you.  Just love their smiles as well.

Ok, so if you like an upscale pizza joint, with homemade crust, the best ingredients from around the world, mixed with local, farm grown veggies, bread baked that day, the creamiest butter you will ever taste, then go check them out.

data.title: Passing through
data.text: We were driving down the freeway and felt like some pizza so we chose Vagabonds after reading the stellar reviews.  The place had character, and the food was ok, but not as fantastic as other's described.  The service was very good.  It is quite pricy for what you get.  All the sodas are bottled so no free refills.  A little bread and butter appetizer is $3.  The pizza was a little bland and the toppings were sparse.  They do not offer parmigiana cheese to add flavor.  I drive that stretch of freeway often and I think I will keep looking for a real good pizza place.

data.title: Excellence
data.text: Vagabond Pizza is what happens when people who are truly passionate about the food they create, open a restaurant. You will not be disappointed. Born as a food truck they gained a lot of local popularity due to their great food and friendly personalities. They have definitely carried this over to their restaurant. Top notch food, and excellent service. I really enjoy pairing my favorite pizza with a local craft beer from their tap system. They have a very extensive wine list as well. The atmosphere is perfect. Be aware that they can get crowded during lunch and dinner, so you might be in for a wait at times. Also, you WILL want to save room for dessert.

owner_response.author: Jessie A, Owner at Vagabond Pizza, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words; so very sweet! I'm so glad you enjoyed the restaurant, we look forward to seeing you again soon. #cheers
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A gem in the heart of downtown!
data.text: Vagabond is an excellent little gem in the heart of Abilene! Their caprese salad is a delicious and authentic treat, and their wedge salad feels original with green chile ranch dressing. The rotation of pizzas are creative and tasty, and never disappointing! We found the staff to be friendly and knowledgeable about the beer and wine, as well as the food. You can see the folks hand tossing the personal sized pizza and they make it when ordered so the wait can be a bit on the longer side but with all of the great starters and drinks you won't be bored! Vagabond is a welcome addition to the Abilene food scene for any foodie! They're just what Abilene needed! I'm so glad they're here!
